result.execSummary:
The defendant Wojciech Kowalski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  AODA and comply.  6 month probation review  in writing.  Any bond on hand will be applied towards costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wojciech Kowalski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation terminated on 6-10-17; unpaid supervision fees of $440
Defendant to be discharged from probation on 6-10-17; unpaid court obligations of $243
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Wojciech Kowalski, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter sworn ( Ann Pawlik).  Cases called: 15CM226 & 15CM259.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1 of each case.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered in each case.  In both cases Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years each.  Conditions of probation include:  Maintain absolute sobriety.  AODA and comply.  In 15CM226 $543.00 costs.  2 days jail credit.  In 15CM259 $443.00 costs.  4 days jail credit.  Cash bond on hand will be applied towards costs.  6 month review on both in writing.
maintain absolute sobriety at all times.

Translator Ann Pawlik sworn. Defendant Wojciech Kowalski in court, in custody by jail video with Atty. Meyer O'Day, special for public defender officer.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $200 cash bond set with maintain absolute sobriety at all times.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 10:10 am.  Return date scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 02:45 pm. Dates work for translator.
